Detailed Description

Class that handles the timers.

Will allow the programmer to use high resolution timers.

Member Function Documentation

void Timer::addTime ( int  iMilisecs_  ) 

Adds a certain amount of miliseconds onto the timer.

Parameters:
miliSecs The number of miliseconds to add to the timer. A negative number can be passed in to take off time.

unsigned int Timer::getTimePassed (  ) 

Returns the amount of miliseconds that have passed on the timer.

Returns:
unsigned int The number of miliseconds that have passed.

bool Timer::hasPassedTime ( int  iMilisecs_  ) 

Checks whether or not the timer has passed a certain amount of miliseconds.

Parameters:
miliSecs The number of miliseconds that is in question.
Returns:
bool Whether or not the timer passed that number of miliseconds.

void Timer::reset (  ) 

Resets the timer back to zero seconds.

Resets the timer back to zero seconds. This does not however stop the timer if it is running.

void Timer::start (  ) 

Starts a stopped timer.

Starts a timer that is not currently running. Will cause no effect if called on an already running timer.

void Timer::stop (  ) 

Stops the running timer.

Stops the timer if it is running. Does not reset the time back to zero. Nothing will happen if you call this on an already stopped timer.
